@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2007-2010 Derrell Lipman License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Derrell Lipman (derrell) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
A simple tree data model used as the table model The object structure of a single node of the tree is: 

 {


   type           : qx.ui.treevirtual.MTreePrimitive.Type.LEAF,
   parentNodeId   : 23,
   label          : "My Documents",
   bSelected      : true,
   bOpened        : true,
   bHideOpenClose : false,
   icon           : "images/folder.gif",
   iconSelected   : "images/folder_selected.gif",
   cellStyle      : "background-color:cyan"
   labelStyle     : "background-color:red;color:white"

   columnData     : [
                      null,
                      "text of column 1",
                      "text of column 2"
                    ],

   data           : {
                      application :
                      {

                          foo: "bar",
                          ...
                      },
                      MDragAndDropSupport :
                      {





                      },
                      ...
                    },





   nodeId         : 42,
   children       : [ ],
   level          : 2,
   bFirstChild    : true,
   lastChild      : [ false ],



 }

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gives the user the opportunity to filter the model. The filter function is called for every node in the model. It gets as an argument the node object and has to return true if the given data should be shown and false if the given data should be ignored.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Rows, resorted into tree order as necessary

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Tree nodes, organized with hierarchy

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Map nodeArr index to rowArr index. The index of this array is the index of _nodeArr, and the values in this array are the indexes into _rowArr.

@description.body: Column for tree nodes

@description.body: Returns the column index the model is sorted by. This model is never sorted, so -1 is returned.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Specifies which column the tree is to be displayed in. The tree is displayed using the SimpleTreeDataCellRenderer. Other columns may be provided which use different cell renderers. Setting the tree column involves more than simply setting this column index; it also requires setting an appropriate cell renderer for this column, that knows how to render a tree. The expected and typical method of setting the tree column is to provide it in the 'custom' parameter to the TreeVirtual constructor, which also initializes the proper cell renderers. This method does not set any cell renderers. If you wish to call this method on your own, you should also manually set the cell renderer for the specified column, and likely also set the cell renderer for column 0 (the former tree column) to something appropriate to your data.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
columnIndex {Integer}
   The index of the column in which the tree should be displayed.
@param.description: The index of the column in which the tree should be displayed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the column in which the tree is to be displayed.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Integer}
   The column in which the tree is to be displayed
@return.description: The column in which the tree is to be displayed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the node object specific to a currently visible row. In this simple tree data model, that's the same as retrieving the value of the tree column of the specified row.

@throws.body:
{Error}
   Thrown if the row index is out of bounds.
@throws.description: Thrown if the row index is out of bounds.

@param.body:
rowIndex {Integer}
   The index of the row.
@param.description: The index of the row.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Object}
   The node object associated with the specified row.
@return.description: The node object associated with the specified row.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Prune the tree by removing, recursively, all of a node's children. If requested, also remove the node itself.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
nodeReference {Object | Integer}
   The node to be pruned from the tree.  The node can be represented
   either by the node object, or the node id (as would have been
   returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)
@param.description:
The node to be pruned from the tree.  The node can be represented
   either by the node object, or the node id (as would have been
   returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)

@param.name: @param
@param.description: If true then remove the node identified by nodeId as well as all of the children.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the node object or id is not valid.
@throws.description: If the node object or id is not valid.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Move a node in the tree.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
moveNodeReference {Object | Integer}
   The node to be moved.  The node can be represented
   either by the node object, or the node id (as would have been
   returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)
@param.description:
The node to be moved.  The node can be represented
   either by the node object, or the node id (as would have been
   returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
parentNodeReference {Object | Integer}
   The new parent node, which must not be a LEAF.  The node can be
   represented either by the node object, or the node id (as would have
   been returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)
@param.description:
The new parent node, which must not be a LEAF.  The node can be
   represented either by the node object, or the node id (as would have
   been returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the node object or id is not valid.
@throws.description: If the node object or id is not valid.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If one tries to add a child to a non-existent parent.
@throws.description: If one tries to add a child to a non-existent parent.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If one tries to add a node to a leaf.
@throws.description: If one tries to add a node to a leaf.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Orders the node and creates all data needed to render the tree.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
A node identifier, as previously returned by {@link #addBranch} or
   {@link #addLeaf}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: level {Integer} the level in the hierarchy
@param.description: the level in the hierarchy

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Calculates the lastChild flags to the nodes, so that the tree can render the tree lines right.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
A node identifier, as previously returned by {@link #addBranch} or
   {@link #addLeaf}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the last child flag for a node and all it's parents.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: node {Object} the node object
@param.description: the node object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: isLastChild {Boolean} whether the node is the last child
@param.description: whether the node is the last child

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Renders the tree data.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the whole data en bulk, or notifies the data model that node modifications are complete.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
nodeArr {Array | null}
   Pass either an Array of node objects, or null.
   If non-null, nodeArr is an array of node objects containing the
   entire tree to be displayed.  If loading the whole data en bulk in
   this way, it is assumed that the data is correct!  No error checking
   or validation is done.  You'd better know what you're doing!  Caveat
   emptor.
   If nodeArr is null, then this call is a notification that the user
   has completed building or modifying a tree by issuing a series of
   calls to {@link #addBranch} and/or {@link #addLeaf}.
@param.description:
Pass either an Array of node objects, or null.
   If non-null, nodeArr is an array of node objects containing the
   entire tree to be displayed.  If loading the whole data en bulk in
   this way, it is assumed that the data is correct!  No error checking
   or validation is done.  You'd better know what you're doing!  Caveat
   emptor.
   If nodeArr is null, then this call is a notification that the user
   has completed building or modifying a tree by issuing a series of
   calls to {@link #addBranch} and/or {@link #addLeaf}.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the parameter has the wrong type.
@throws.description: If the parameter has the wrong type.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the array of node data.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array}
  Array of node objects.
  See {@link qx.ui.treevirtual.SimpleTreeDataModel} for a description
  nodes in this array.
@return.description:
Array of node objects.
  See {@link qx.ui.treevirtual.SimpleTreeDataModel} for a description
  nodes in this array.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set state attributes of a node.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
nodeReference {Object | Integer}
   The node to have its attributes set.  The node can be represented
   either by the node object, or the node id (as would have been
   returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)
@param.description:
The node to have its attributes set.  The node can be represented
   either by the node object, or the node id (as would have been
   returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: attributes {Map} Each property name in the map may correspond to the property names of a node which are specified as USER-PROVIDED ATTRIBUTES in {@link SimpleTreeDataModel}. Each property value will be assigned to the corresponding property of the node specified by nodeId.
@param.description: Each property name in the map may correspond to the property names of a node which are specified as USER-PROVIDED ATTRIBUTES in {@link SimpleTreeDataModel}. Each property value will be assigned to the corresponding property of the node specified by nodeId.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the node object or id is not valid.
@throws.description: If the node object or id is not valid.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the mapping of nodes to rendered rows. This function is intended for use by the cell renderer, not by users of this class. It is also useful to select a node.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array}
   The array containing mappings of nodes to rendered rows.
@return.description: The array containing mappings of nodes to rendered rows.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This operation maps nodes to rowIndexes. It does the opposite job to {@link #getNodeFromRow}.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
The id of the node (as would have been returned by addBranch(),
   addLeaf(), etc.) to get the row index for.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} row index for the given node ID
@return.description: row index for the given node ID

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This operation maps rowIndexes to nodes. It does the opposite job to {@link #getRowFromNodeId}. This function is useful to map selection (row based) to nodes.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: rowIndex {Integer} zero-based row index.
@param.description: zero-based row index.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Clear all selections in the data model. This method does not clear selections displayed in the widget, and is intended for internal use, not by users of this class.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the nodes that are currently selected.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array}
   An array containing the nodes that are currently selected.
@return.description: An array containing the nodes that are currently selected.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property filter. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #filter}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property filter. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #filter}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property filter. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #filter}.
